description: A full-stack Astro starter kit that feels freeing and is free.
hero_subtitle: A full-stack Astro starter kit that feels freeing and is free.
half_text_half_image_subtitle_1: Save time, money, and headaches by using Freedom Stack.
half_text_half_image_title_2: No need to reinvent the wheel
half_text_half_image_subtitle_2: Auth? Database? Components? This starter kit has you covered.
half_text_half_image_subtitle_3: Enjoy building apps, not configuring servers. Incredibly easy to deploy.
quote_quote: enjoyed learning about Freedom Stack, Cam. Really a refreshing take on SaaS boilerplates ✨ plus I love Astro, too!
faq_answer_1: Freedom Stack is a full-stack Astro starter kit that feels freeing and is free.
faq_question_2: How can I learn more about Astro?
faq_answer_2: If you want to learn more about the frontend layer, I recommend the [Astro Web Framework Crash Course by freeCodeCamp](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e-hTm5VmofI) or check out [Astro's Community Educational Content](https://docs.astro.build/en/community-resources/content/).
faq_question_3: How can I learn more about Alpine.js?
faq_answer_3: If you want to learn more about Alpine.js, I recommend [Learn Alpine.js on codecourse](https://codecourse.com/courses/learn-alpine-js).
faq_question_4: How can I learn more about the libSQL database layer?
faq_answer_4: If you want to learn more about the database layer, I recommend learning from [High Performance SQLite course](https://highperformancesqlite.com/), sponsored by [Turso](https://turso.tech/).
faq_question_5: How can I learn more about Clerk Auth?
faq_answer_5: [Learn more about the Clerk and Astro integration.](https://clerk.com/docs/references/astro/overview)
faq_question_6: How do I deploy Freedom Stack?
faq_answer_6: You can deploy Freedom Stack to [Netlify](https://app.netlify.com/start/deploy?repository=https://github.com/cameronapak/freedom-stack).
faq_question_7: How can I learn more about HTMX?
faq_question_8: How can I learn more about daisyUI?
faq_question_9: How can I contribute to Freedom Stack?
faq_answer_9: If you'd like to contribute to Freedom Stack, please [open an issue](https://github.com/cameronapak/freedom-stack/issues) or [submit a pull request](https://github.com/cameronapak/freedom-stack/pulls). Or, if you can submit financially, please consider [buying me a coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/campak).
letter_content_markdown:
I dream of a lightweight, simple web development stack that invokes a fun web experience at the cheapest possible maintenance, backend, and server cost. As close to free as possible. I wanted to provide a stack that's powerful like Ruby on Rails _("The One Person Framework")_, but with the ease and "vanilla" web dev feel of Astro. Freedom Stack is built on three core principles:

- **Approachable** — Making web development feel natural and comfortable, especially for newcomers
- **Flow-able** — Using an HTML-first approach that helps you focus and get in the zone faster
- **Pocket-friendly** — Keeping it financially maintainable for everyone, from indie hackers to startups

This is only the beginning. It's a joy to work on this project and to give it freely. Long story short, I was bed-ridden sick for about 7 months, not knowing if I'd make it out. [God](https://www.gotquestions.org/what-is-the-gospel.html) took care of me through friends and family. He healed me on the inside before he healed me on the outside. Ever since, I've had a deep desire to create digital experiences that lead to freedom. May Freedom Stack be a blessing to you to create whatever dreams and visions on your heart and mind.

Freedom Stack:

- Feels vanilla, with the power of modern frameworks. No need for Docker. Just throw it on Netlify and you're good to go.
- Is built with Astro, Alpine.js, HTMX, Astro DB, Clerk Auth, Preline UI, daisyUI, & Lucide Icons. Enjoy building apps.
- Has a low barrier to entry, making it easy to learn and start building fast. Get in the zone and stay in it.

_— [Cam Pak](https://cameronpak.com)_
